content:
UserTrackingRecord Class

Definition

Contains the data sent to a tracking service by the runtime tracking infrastructure when a UserTrackPoint is matched.

In this Article

[ECMA2Yaml.Models.ECMAAttribute]
public class UserTrackingRecord : System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingRecord
Inheritance
Object
TrackingRecord
UserTrackingRecord
Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object, Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object, Object)
ToString()

Remarks

Note

This material discusses types and namespaces that are obsolete. For more information, see Deprecated Types in Windows Workflow Foundation 4.5.

When the runtime tracking infrastructure matches a UserTrackPoint in a TrackingProfile, it sends a UserTrackingRecord to the tracking service over the TrackingChannel associated with that tracking service. The tracking service can perform whatever action is required on the data in the tracking record.

Constructors

UserTrackingRecord()

Initializes a new instance of the UserTrackingRecord class

public UserTrackingRecord ();
Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

Remarks

This constructor is called by the runtime tracking infrastructure.

UserTrackingRecord(Type, String, Guid, Guid, DateTime, Int32, String, Object)

Initializes a new instance of the UserTrackingRecord class by using the specified parameters.

public UserTrackingRecord (Type activityType, string qualifiedName, Guid contextGuid, Guid parentContextGuid, DateTime eventDateTime, int eventOrder, string userDataKey, object userData);
Parameters
activityType
Type

The Type of the activity associated with the user event.

qualifiedName
String

The stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.QualifiedName* of the activity associated with the user event.

contextGuid
Guid

A number that identifies the ActivityExecutionContext of the activity associated with the user event.

parentContextGuid
Guid

A number that identifies the ActivityExecutionContext of the parent activity of the activity associated with the user event.

eventDateTime
DateTime

A DateTime that indicates the date and time of the user event associated with the tracking record.

eventOrder
Int32

The relative order in which the user event associated with this tracking record occurred in the workflow instance.

userDataKey
String

A key associated with the user data for this tracking record, or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

userData
Object

The user data associated with the user event.

Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

Properties

ActivityType

Gets or sets the common language runtime (CLR) type of the activity that emitted the user data for which this UserTrackingRecord was created.

public Type ActivityType { get; set; }
Value
Type

The Type of the activity that emitted the user data.

Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

Remarks

This property is set by the runtime tracking infrastructure.

Annotations

Gets the collection of annotations associated with the user event.

public override System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingAnnotationCollection Annotations { get; }
Value
TrackingAnnotationCollection

A TrackingAnnotationCollection that contains the annotations that are associated with the user event by the UserTrackPoint that was matched in the TrackingProfile.

Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

Remarks

You can specify annotations to be associated with a user event in Annotations. When the runtime tracking infrastructure matches the UserTrackPoint, it returns these annotations in Annotations.

This property is set by the runtime tracking infrastructure.

Body

Gets a list containing any additional data extracted from the workflow for the UserTrackPoint that was matched.

public System.Collections.Generic.IList<System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingDataItem> Body { get; }
Value
IList<TrackingDataItem>

A list of TrackingDataItem objects each of which contains a single piece of extracted data and its associated annotations.

Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

Remarks

When a UserTrackPoint is matched, the runtime tracking infrastructure can extract data from the workflow instance. The data to be extracted is specified by Extracts. Extracts can contain ActivityDataTrackingExtract objects, which specify member data to be extracted from the activity associated with the user event, and WorkflowDataTrackingExtract objects, which specify member data to be extracted from the root activity of the workflow. Each type of extract can also specify annotations to be returned with the extracted data. The runtime tracking infrastructure encapsulates each piece of extracted data and its associated annotations in a TrackingDataItem which it adds to Body.

Because the user data pushed to the tracking service by the user event is contained in UserData, Body will frequently be an empty list. This property is set by the runtime tracking infrastructure.

ContextGuid

Context of the activity.

public Guid ContextGuid { get; set; }
Value
Guid

A number that identifies the context of the activity.

Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

EventArgs

Always a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) for a UserTrackingRecord.

public override EventArgs EventArgs { get; set; }
Value
EventArgs

A null reference (Nothing) for a UserTrackingRecord.

Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

Remarks

There is no event data associated with a user event, therefore, EventArgs has no meaning and is always a null reference (Nothing).

The user data that is pushed to the runtime tracking infrastructure by whichever one of the TrackData or TrackData methods that caused the user event is sent in UserData. Any data extracts that are associated with the user event by the UserTrackPoint are encapsulated in TrackingDataItem objects and sent in Body.

This property is set by the runtime tracking infrastructure.

EventDateTime

Gets or sets the date and time that the user event occurred.

public override DateTime EventDateTime { get; set; }
Value
DateTime

A DateTime value.

Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

Remarks

The DateTime is Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

This property is set by the runtime tracking infrastructure.

EventOrder

Gets or sets a value that indicates the order of the user event that matched the UserTrackPoint in the workflow instance.

public override int EventOrder { get; set; }
Value
Int32

A value that indicates the order of the user event in the workflow instance.

Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

Remarks

EventOrder indicates the order of the user event that matched the UserTrackPoint relative to the other tracking events emitted by the workflow instance. EventOrder will be unique within a workflow instance, but it is not guaranteed to be sequential.

This property is set by the runtime tracking infrastructure.

ParentContextGuid

Context of the parent activity.

public Guid ParentContextGuid { get; set; }
Value
Guid

A number that identifies the context of the parent activity.

Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

QualifiedName

Gets or sets the qualified name of the activity associated with this UserTrackingRecord.

public string QualifiedName { get; set; }
Value
String

The stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.QualifiedName* of the Activity from which the user data for this user event was emitted.

Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

Remarks

This property is set by the runtime tracking infrastructure.

UserData

Gets and sets the user data for this user event.

public object UserData { get; set; }
Value
Object

The user data for which the UserTrackingRecord was created.

Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

Remarks

UserData contains the actual data pushed to the runtime tracking infrastructure by whichever one of the overloaded TrackData or TrackData methods is responsible for the user event.

This property is set by the runtime tracking infrastructure.

UserDataKey

Gets or sets a key associated with the user data for this UserTrackingRecord.

public string UserDataKey { get; set; }
Value
String

A string key associated with the user data for this tracking record.

Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

Remarks

An activity or workflow designer can use either System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionContext.TrackData(String, Object) or System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.TrackData(String, Object) to specify a key to associate with the user data pushed to the runtime tracking infrastructure. UserDataKey contains this key. If no key is specified, UserDataKey is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
